page.title: 11In The Newspapers:Mickleton
page.content: Noted in the Evesham Journal June 1985 HOUSES FOR SALE:a modern four bed- roomed house with double garage, Â£62,500:an older three-bedroomed house with three quarters of an acre Â£70,000 The JUNIOR PLAYING FIELD AGM was attended by 17 people.Doors were to be put on the damaged shelter in the field and kept locked,the school to have use of the shelter.Two young Committee members said there would be nowhere to sit.Vandalism had cost Â£230 that year.THREE HERONS found dead in the Vale of Evesham were found to contain lethal levels of the pesti- cides DDT and Dieldrin.MICKLETON 60 CLUB raised Â£140 with bring-&-buy sales,cake and plant stalls.A Straw- berry Tea was to have been held on the Senior Playing Field,but was moved to King George's Hall because of bad weather.(The houses are in Mickleton).
